public interface Flow
extends SimulationObject

The process an element has to carry out.

A flow is structured as a graph, so it can have successors and predecessor. Successors can be added by using link(Flow). This implies invoking the addPredecessor(Flow) method for the new successor. By creating this basic structure, the Sequence workflow pattern (WFP1) is implemented.

Flows can have not only successors and predecessors, but can be enclosed by an structured flow, which is considered its parent.

This flow can be requested to be carried out by an element. To do this, a set of user-defined conditions are first checked by invoking beforeRequest. If this method is true, the Element can definitely request this flow.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

Method Detail

link

void link(Flow successor)
Adds a flow's successor. This method must invoke successor.addPredecessor to build the graph properly.

Parameters:
successor - This flow's successor.

addPredecessor

void addPredecessor(Flow predecessor)
Notifies this flow that it has been linked (i.e. added as a successor) to another flow.

Parameters:
predecessor - This flow's predecessor.

getParent

StructuredFlow getParent()
Returns the structured flow which contains this flow.

Returns:
the structured flow which contains this flow.

setParent

void setParent(StructuredFlow parent)
Sets the structured flow which contains this flow.

Parameters:
parent - the structured flow which contains this flow.

setRecursiveStructureLink

void setRecursiveStructureLink(StructuredFlow parent,
                               java.util.Set<Flow> visited)
Sets the structured flow which contains this flow and does the same for the successors of this flow.

Parameters:
parent - the structured flow which contains this flow and its successors.
visited - list of already visited flows (to prevent infinite recursion when arbitrary loops are present)

beforeRequest

boolean beforeRequest(Element e)
Allows a user to add conditions which the element requesting this flow must meet before request this flow.

Parameters:
e - The element trying to request this flow.
Returns:
True if this flow can be requested; false in other case.
